quotes.text: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
You have power over your mind, not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.
If it is not right, do not do it; if it is not true, do not say it.
When you arise in the morning, think of what a privilege it is to be alive.
The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.
Confine yourself to the present.
It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.
Look well into thyself; there is a source of strength which will always spring up.
He who lives in harmony with himself lives in harmony with the universe.
Reject your sense of injury and the injury itself disappears.
The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
What we do now echoes in eternity.
Accept whatever comes to you woven in the pattern of your destiny.
Perfection of character is this: to live each day as if it were your last.
Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth.
The impediment to action advances action. What stands in the way becomes the way.
Observe constantly that all things take place by change.
Do every act of your life as though it were the very last act of your life.
To live happily is an inward power of the soul.
Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor.
As is a tale, so is life: not how long it is, but how good it is, is what matters.
Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.
He suffers more than necessary, who suffers before it is necessary.
If you want to live, do not worry about your possessions.
We are more often frightened than hurt; and we suffer more in imagination than in reality.
The greatest remedy for anger is delay.
It is a rough road that leads to the heights of greatness.
Hang on to your youthful enthusiasms—you’ll be able to use them better when you’re older.
A gift consists not in what is done or given, but in the intention of the giver or doer.
Associate with people who are likely to improve you.
Every new beginning comes from some other beginning’s end.
It is the power of the mind to be unconquerable.
Nothing, to my way of thinking, is a better proof of a well-ordered mind than a man’s ability to stop just where he is.
To wish to be well is a part of becoming well.
Wealth is the slave of a wise man. The master of a fool.
The time will come when diligent research over long periods will bring to light things which now lie hidden.
First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
No man is free who is not master of himself.
It’s not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
The key is to keep company only with people who uplift you.
Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.
Men are disturbed not by things, but by the view which they take of them.
If you want to improve, be content to be thought foolish and stupid.
Don’t explain your philosophy. Embody it.
Freedom is the only worthy goal in life. It is won by disregarding things that lie beyond our control.
Circumstances don’t make the man, they only reveal him to himself.
If evil be said of thee, and if it be true, correct yourself; if it be a lie, laugh at it.
The essence of philosophy is that a man should so live that his happiness shall depend as little as possible on external things.
Only the educated are free.
Keep your intentions pure.
To accuse others for one’s own misfortunes is a sign of want of education.
Know, first, who you are, and then adorn yourself accordingly.
Small-minded people blame others. Average people blame themselves. Wise people blame no one.
We should not have either a blunt knife or a freedom of speech which is careless and rough.
No great thing is created suddenly, any more than a bunch of grapes or a fig.
Attach yourself to what is spiritually superior.
